Economy & Tax.details: Income tax cuts for all taxpayers, corporate tax compliance, instant asset write-off ($20,000), superannuation tax on balances over $3M

Healthcare.details: $8.5B Medicare investment, 50 more Medicare Urgent Care Clinics, reduce PBS co-payment to $25, bulk billing support

Housing.details: 1.2M new homes target, Help to Buy shared equity scheme, $10B Housing Australia Future Fund, foreign investor restrictions

Climate & Energy.details: Net zero by 2050, renewable energy expansion, $2.3B home batteries program, no new coal plants

Immigration.details: Balanced migration program, skilled worker focus, humanitarian intake maintained

Education.details: Increased school funding, free TAFE places, student debt relief (20% reduction proposed)

Cost of Living.details: Energy bill rebates, Medicare investments, cheaper medicines, tax cuts for working families

Defence & Security.details: AUKUS partnership, increased defence spending, regional security focus

Social Services.details: NDIS improvements, aged care reforms, disability support expansion

Infrastructure.details: Transport infrastructure, broadband expansion, renewable energy grid

Regional Australia.details: Infrastructure investment, regional healthcare, telecommunications improvement

Workers Rights.details: Penalty rates protection, wage increases, industrial relations reform, multi-employer bargaining

Indigenous Affairs.details: Indigenous voice implementation, closing the gap initiatives, cultural preservation

Technology & Innovation.details: Tech sector investment, digital skills training, cybersecurity enhancement

Economy & Tax.source: Roy Morgan 2025 - Cost of living concerns (57%) drive mixed attitudes
Economy & Tax.notes: Australians prioritize cost of living relief but are divided on taxation approaches

Healthcare.source: Australian Health Consumer Sentiment Survey 2021 - 84% satisfied with current services
Healthcare.notes: Strong support for public healthcare, but concerns about workforce and costs

Housing.source: University of Sydney 2025 - Housing crisis impacts most sectors of society
Housing.notes: Housing crisis creates broad support for government action across political spectrum

Climate & Energy.source: Lowy Institute Poll 2025 - 51% say urgent action needed, 33% gradual approach
Climate & Energy.notes: Climate concern declining slightly but majority still want action

Immigration.source: Lowy Institute 2024 & Roy Morgan 2025 - 48% think intake too high, but 90% support multiculturalism
Immigration.notes: Contradictory views: support diversity but want lower immigration numbers

Education.source: Roy Morgan 2025 - Education ranks 10th in voter priorities at 14%
Education.notes: Education not a top priority but broad support for public education investment

Cost of Living.source: Roy Morgan 2025 - 57% cite keeping costs down as most important issue
Cost of Living.notes: Top voter concern driving support for government intervention

Defence & Security.source: Lowy Institute Poll 2025 - Mixed views on AUKUS and regional security
Defence & Security.notes: Bipartisan support for strong defence but debate over approach

Social Services.source: Australian Health Consumer Sentiment Survey 2021 - Strong support for disability and aged care
Social Services.notes: Broad support for social safety net, concerns about sustainability

Infrastructure.source: Roy Morgan 2025 - Infrastructure linked to regional development priorities
Infrastructure.notes: Broad bipartisan support for infrastructure investment

Regional Australia.source: Roy Morgan 2025 - Regional concerns about services and infrastructure
Regional Australia.notes: Strong cross-party support for regional development with different priorities

Workers Rights.source: Roy Morgan 2025 - Worker concerns embedded in cost of living issues
Workers Rights.notes: Support for worker protection amid cost of living pressures

Indigenous Affairs.source: Post-Voice referendum polling 2023-2024 - Divided but majority support reconciliation
Indigenous Affairs.notes: Voice referendum defeat but continued support for reconciliation measures

Technology & Innovation.source: Various polls 2024-2025 - Technology generally seen as positive
Technology & Innovation.notes: Broad support for innovation with concerns about privacy and regulation

metadata.data_source: Australian Electoral Commission, Party Websites, Parliamentary Records
